Hello, can someone help me with this: I have 4 blogs where tagging will be used. Im working on a general overview page where all blogposts of all blogs will be listed. On this page I’ll have a filter “Filter by topic”.
My question is: How do i make a bloglisting of a specific topic with all posts of the 4 blogs with is tagged by that topic
Try using the <https://designers.HubSpot.com/en/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-functions#blog-recent-tag-posts>  tag for listing out the recent posts. You can then add a param(s) for the specific tags
as first parameter, i need to put the blog of which I want to be listed. But i need a combination of 4 blogs
Hi, I’m trying to use a menu() function, but with an id that is being supplied through a module field.

Continuing - the output with menu(12099265267) outputs a menu structure with some links and menu(module.navid) does too. However, using the second one in a “for” loop results in HubSpot having a fit. It won’t even save the page, due to a token error.

Tried duplicating this and got the same thing... interestingly using a field variable in the menu() function seems to work when used within expression delimiters {{ }} but it errors when used in statement delimiters {% %}. Does HubL run the menu functions in statement delimiters before it evaluates the field variables?
